settings.heading: U.S. Construction Industry Overview
settings.description1: The construction industry is a cornerstone of the American economy. As of 2024, the sector employs over 8.1 million workers and contributes approximately $2.1 trillion annually to the U.S. GDP. From residential builds and commercial skyscrapers to public infrastructure and renewable energy projects, construction is booming—but it also remains one of the most dangerous industries in the country.
settings.description2: According to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics, construction consistently ranks in the top five for workplace injuries and fatalities. In 2022 alone, there were over 169,000 nonfatal injuries and over 1,000 fatalities reported in construction. The top causes? Falls, struck-by objects, electrocutions, and caught-in/between incidents—most of which are preventable with the proper Personal Protective Equipment (PPE).

settings.description1:
U.S. Manufacturing Industry Overview

The manufacturing sector is the engine behind the U.S. economy, accounting for over 12.9 million jobs and nearly $2.8 trillion in economic output annually. From advanced automotive plants and electronics assembly lines to heavy equipment production and consumer goods packaging, manufacturers across the country rely on a skilled workforce to keep production moving.

But this environment also brings serious risks. Workers in manufacturing facilities routinely face mechanical hazards, chemical exposure, thermal risks, and high-noise environments. As production intensifies and automation introduces new risks, protecting workers with modern, compliant PPE is more important than ever.
settings.description2:
• Over 300,000 nonfatal injuries were reported in manufacturing in 2022.
  • The most common injuries include hand lacerations, repetitive strain, burns, slips, and hearing damage.
  • The average cost of a single lost-time injury in this sector exceeds $40,000.

The reality:Nearly all of these injuries are preventable with the right Personal Protective Equipment.

settings.description:
U.S. Oil & Gas Industry Overview

The oil and gas industry is the lifeblood of the American economy—powering homes, vehicles, and businesses. It employs over 600,000 workers across upstream exploration, midstream transportation, and downstream refining. From shale fields in Texas to deepwater operations in the Gulf of Mexico, this sector is driven by innovation—but defined by danger.

According to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics, oil and gas consistently rank among the top industries for workplace fatalities, largely due to explosions, toxic chemical exposure, electrical hazards, and confined space entry. Even minor errors can lead to catastrophic results, making proper PPE not just a regulatory requirement—but a literal life-saver.

Workforce realities in oil & gas:

  • High turnover and contract-based crews require fast onboarding and easy-to-use PPE
  • Harsh climates, remote locations, and flammable environments are standard
  • One PPE failure can result in site shutdowns, fines, or tragedy

settings.heading: The Critical Role of PPE in Manufacturing Safety
settings.sub_heading: PPE is the frontline barrier between workers and injury. Whether it’s a metal shop, food production facility, or clean electronics lab, workers need equipment tailored to their specific tasks and environments.
settings.sub_heading1: Common risks PPE helps prevent in manufacturing:

settings.description:
Key Statistics

  • Nearly 1 in 4 injuries involve the hands—often from improper glove use or lack thereof.
  • Noise-induced hearing loss is one of the most frequently reported occupational illnesses.
  • U.S. businesses lose over $20 billion annually due to RSIs alone.

settings.question: How can I ensure PPE compliance across multiple U.S. states and facilities?
settings.answer: We help nationwide manufacturers standardize equipment across plants, ensuring compliance with OSHA and ANSI guidelines. We also assist with state-specific interpretations, particularly in California (Cal/OSHA), New York, and Texas.

settings.question: Are your gloves suitable for both assembly line and heavy machinery tasks?
settings.answer: Yes. We offer a wide range—from cut-resistant and impact-rated gloves for mechanical tasks to ultra-flexible nitrile options for fine assembly or electronics.

settings.question: Can your PPE withstand long shifts in hot or cold factory environments?
settings.answer: Absolutely. We supply temperature-rated PPE for freezer work or summer production floors, with moisture-wicking, breathable materials for comfort and compliance.

settings.question: Do you support custom PPE packages for specialized production lines (e.g., cleanrooms, food-grade, high-voltage)?
settings.answer: Yes. We offer PPE solutions tailored for GMP, anti-static (ESD-safe), or cleanroom-rated environments. Our team can build PPE matrices specific to your workflow.

settings.question: What are your lead times for high-volume reorders during production spikes or audits?
settings.answer: We keep core inventory stocked in U.S. warehouses and offer priority restocking and pre-kitted orders for seasonal demands or audit prep.

settings.question: Do you offer hearing protection for environments with prolonged machine noise?
settings.answer: Yes. We provide OSHA-compliant protection ranging from disposable foam earplugs to high-NRR earmuffs ideal for CNC, stamping, or bottling operations.

settings.question: Can your PPE help reduce repetitive strain injuries (RSIs)?
settings.answer: Definitely. Our ergonomic supports include anti-fatigue mats, glove padding, wrist braces, and back supports to ease strain on high-repetition tasks.

settings.question: How can I simplify PPE inventory management across departments?
settings.answer: We offer inventory planning tools, usage tracking sheets, and barcode-labeled gear for streamlined procurement and compliance visibility.

settings.question: Can we brand or color-code PPE for departments or safety awareness?
settings.answer: Yes. We provide PPE in a range of colors and offer branding services to help segment zones (e.g., QA, production, maintenance) while promoting company identity.

settings.question: What training and onboarding materials do you provide post-sale?
settings.answer: We offer digital user manuals, wall-mounted safety posters, and training decks for new hires—plus remote support for safety officers rolling out updated PPE protocols.

settings.heading: Frequently Asked Questions About PPE for Manufacturing Facilities
Protection That Powers Production
settings.description: Manufacturing is high-speed, high-pressure, and high-value. Every missed step or missed piece of PPE can put productivity—and people—at risk. That’s why GE PPE delivers reliable, ergonomic, and compliant gear built for America’s factory floors. From welding bays to packing lines, we help you build a safer tomorrow—one shift at a time.
